org.spongepowered.api.block

Interface BlockLoc

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DataHolder

    public interface BlockLoc
extends DataHolder
    Represents a block at a specific location in an Extent.

    A BlockLoc is not a copy of a block's data. The type of block a BlockLoc refers to can change over time. To get a copy of the block's data, use getSnapshot().

    Instances are immutable, however, so they will never refer to a different location.

      • replaceWith

        void replaceWith(BlockSnapshot snapshot)
        Replace the block at this position with a copy of the given snapshot.

        Changing the snapshot afterwards will not affect the block that has been placed at this location.

        Parameters:
        snapshot - The snapshot

      • getLuminance

        byte getLuminance()
        Get the light level for this object.

        Higher levels indicate a higher luminance.

        Returns:
        A light level, nominally between 0 and 15, inclusive

      • getLuminanceFromSky

        byte getLuminanceFromSky()
        Get the light level for this object that is caused by an overhead sky.

        Higher levels indicate a higher luminance. If no sky is overheard, the return value may be 0.

        Returns:
        A light level, nominally between 0 and 15, inclusive

      • getLuminanceFromGround

        byte getLuminanceFromGround()
        Get the light level for this object that is caused by everything other than the sky.

        Higher levels indicate a higher luminance.

        Returns:
        A light level, nominally between 0 and 15, inclusive

      • getSnapshot

        BlockSnapshot getSnapshot()
        Get a snapshot of this block at the current point in time.

        A snapshot is disconnected from the Extent that it was taken from so changes to the original block do not affect the snapshot.

        Returns:
        A snapshot
